articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Sudan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of South Sudan
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Salva Kiir Mayardit, president of South Sudan, on the occasion of the second anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished South Sudan development and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in line with the common interests and desires of the two peoples.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets with Charge D'Affaires a.i. of Syrian Embassy
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets with Charge D'Affaires a.i. of Syrian Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, who paid a farewell call on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets with Charge D' Affaires a.i. of Syrian Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets with Charge D' Affaires a.i. of Syrian Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Haissam Saad, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, who paid a farewell call on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Kye Gwan Back Home
articles.content:
Kim Kye Gwan Back Home
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and his party came back home Tuesday after wrapping up their visit to Russia. 
					 Before taking a flight he met with Alexey Pushkov, chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma.

articles.title: Special Adviser to UN Secretary General Leaves Here
articles.content:
Special Adviser to UN Secretary General Leaves Here
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Wilfried Lemke, special adviser to the Secretary General of the United Nations on Sports for Development and Peace, and his companion left here Tuesday.

articles.title: Reception Given by Egyptian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Egyptian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Egyptian Ambassador to the DPRK Iman Mostafa Abdou Ahmed hosted a reception at his embassy on Tuesday on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the July 23 Revolution in Egypt.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech made at the reception that the July 23 Revolution in Egypt marked an important turning point in the struggle for the dignity and sovereignty of the nation.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the friendly relations between Egypt and the DPRK are growing strong in various fields on the basis of the spirit of mutual respect and cooperation.
					
					 He expressed belief that the heroic Korean people would achieve greater success in their struggle for the prosperity of the country.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun referred to the fact that the Egyptian people have achieved successes in defending the sovereignty of the country and dignity of the nation and achieving socio-economic change and development since the revolution.
					
					 It is the invariable stand of the DPRK government to set store by and develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he noted.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people would as ever stand by the Egyptian people on the road of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Devotes Himself to Agricultural Development
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Devotes Himself to Agricultural Development
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime gave field guidance to a great number of farms to boost the country's grain output.
					 His field guidance was not subject to time or weather conditions.
					
					 He established the Juche method of farming suitable to Korea's geographical conditions and worked heart and soul to put the farming on an intensive basis.
					
					 Whenever visiting farms, he shared with their peasants the experience he gained in cultivating crops on the experimental field of his residence.
					
					 Once, he made a long journey overnight to a farm to see how its rice-planting was going.
					
					 One autumn day Kim Il Sung visited a farm. He asked a work-team leader of the farm to pick up a few ears of maize.
					
					 As it was getting dark, he carefully looked at the ears with the help of the car headlight. When the officials requested him to leave the farm, he told them that he was very satisfied to see the bumper crop and there was nothing more important for him than to discuss ways for the betterment of people's living.
					
					 In March Juche 82 (1993) alone, the President guided nearly 10 consultative meetings of agricultural officials in an effort to settle the food shortage in the country, though he was over 80 years old.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Pays Attention to Developing Economic Development
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Pays Attention to Developing Economic Development
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung in his lifetime rendered active assistance to developing countries in their efforts for progress and prosperity.
					 It was his view on internationalism that revolutionaries should help each other with sincerity, regardless of nationalities.
					
					 In Juche 53 (1964), he dispatched a group of 200 odd technicians to Cuba and in January 1969 sent more technicians at the request of the Cuban government to help its people in socialist economic building.
					
					 In the early 1970s, when the Sri Lankan premier sent a request to Kim Il Sung to give a helping hand to his country's agriculture, he agreed to the request without hesitation.
					
					 Later, the President sent to Sri Lanka 100 odd tractors, pumps, water pumps, plows, some 50,000 meters of plastic pipe and other kinds of farming tools by a cargo ship.
					
					 As the Tanzanian president came to Pyongyang to ask for dispatch of DPRK technicians, Kim Il Sung promised to send as many technicians as he wanted.
					
					 When he heard the news that cholera broke out in an African country, he instructed the DPRK medical workers active there to take a thorough measure for prevention of the epidemics and treat the patients.
					
					 Under his deep attention, as of January 1984, the DPRK helped build 30 factories in 22 countries, establish irrigation systems in more than 20 countries and sent many technicians and experts to some 50 developing nations to assist them in building new society.
					
					 The assistance greatly encouraged the developing nations in their efforts to build self-reliant economy and national culture.

articles.title: US Accused of Misleading Public Opinion on DPRK
articles.content:
US Accused of Misleading Public Opinion on DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The United States staged nuclear war drills in March and April and joint military exercises with various missions in May, pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst phase. Just as it did in June, this month, too, the U.S. is busy with propaganda for building up public opinion to chill the DPRK's positive efforts to open dialogue and ensure peace.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article observes in this regard:
					
					 The propaganda launched by the U.S. reveals that it is nothing but a premeditated campaign to isolate the DPRK to the maximum, blockade against it from all sides and unleash another Korean war.
					
					 The U.S. keen to provoke the second Korean War feels afraid of the fact that the positive efforts of the DPRK to hold dialogue may make the situation on the peninsula go quite contrary to its anticipation and seeks to prevent such development.
					
					 This is well illustrated by its such remarks as "a step in advance for the denuclearization" and "sincere dialogue".
					
					 If the U.S. is interested in ensuring the peace and security on the peninsula even a bit, it should repent of its unjust and illegal actions before making such remarks. The U.S. is, however, oft-repeating such rhetoric.
					
					 Quite contrary to the demands for the disbandment of the "UN Command" and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea reflected in a resolution of the UN General Assembly, the U.S. is using the inauguration of "the Korean War Memorial" aimed at shifting the blame for the war onto the DPRK on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Armistice Agreement as part of the moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to give up a foolish ambition and behave itself.

articles.title: S. Korea Denounced for Diplomacy to Pressurize North to "Dismantle Nukes"
articles.content:
S. Korea Denounced for Diplomacy to Pressurize North to "Dismantle Nukes"
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, was recently reported to have  met with his U.S. and Japanese masters during the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum do discuss pressurizing  "the north to  dismantle its nukes." Meanwhile, the chief secretary for Diplomacy and Security of Chongwadae called for cooperation in the efforts for the "settlement of the nuclear issue of the north" at a high-level security meeting held in Russia. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 What the puppet group uttered is nothing but acts of treachery committed by those steeped in dependence on outsiders and flunkeyism to the marrow of their bones. 
					
					 The attempts made by the group to eliminate even the precious means guaranteeing the independent destiny and prosperity of the nation mean the height of wicked sycophantic and treacherous action. 
					
					 The ulterior aim sought by the group in noisily crying out for the "the north's dismantlement of its nukes," clinging to the coattails of outsiders, is to disarm the DPRK through military collusion with outside forces and bring down its social system. 
					
					 As a matter of fact, the group has massively introduced war equipment into south Korea from abroad and, at the same time, staged war drills against fellow countrymen together with the U.S. 
					
					 The nukes of the DPRK can never be a bargaining chip under any circumstances as they are a shield for justice and peace and treasure of the nation. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never pardon the puppet group for having worked hard to hurt compatriots in collusion with outside forces, warns the commentary.

articles.title: SOFA Should Be Abrogated: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
SOFA Should Be Abrogated: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities concluded humiliating "status of forces agreement" (SOFA) with the U.S. on July 9, 1967.
					 For the past 47 years, the U.S. imperialist aggression forces have committed the whole gamut of heinous crimes such as violence, robbery, murder and sexual assault almost every day in south Korea under the patronage of the agreement and lorded it over as de facto dominator with extraterritorial power.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined article in this regard:
					
					 The agreement is the humiliating document unprecedented in history which proved that south Korea is the U.S. colony. It is also a "criminal permit" which patronages and fosters all kinds of criminal atrocities by the U.S. imperialist aggressors.
					
					 It is the miserable situation of south Korea that the national sovereignty and human dignity are ruthlessly trampled down due to the presence of the U.S. imperialist aggressors. 
					
					 The abrogation of SOFA, a disgrace and shame to the nation, is the demand of the era and a unanimous call of the south Korean people. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities speak loudly of the sixtieth anniversary of the alliance between south Korea and the U.S. that falls this year, far from scrapping the treacherous agreement in its continued pursuance of the sycophancy towards the U.S. and the humiliating policy of dependence on outside forces.
					
					 The history of servitude and disgrace should not be allowed to go on and the SOFA which hurts the dignity and sovereignty of the nation be abrogated at once.

articles.title: Minju Joson Warns Japan against Development of Ballistic Missile
articles.content:
Minju Joson Warns Japan against Development of Ballistic Missile
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- It was reported that the Japanese Ministry of Defence had already started examining the development of ballistic missile with a range of 500 km.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary that this suggests a dramatic change in Japan's military tendency. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 What the Japanese reactionaries seek at present is to completely turn the Self-Defense Forces (SDF) into offensive forces capable of waging a war for overseas aggression, totally unbound to the "Pacifist Constitution".
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff to where the next military action of Japan will lead as it is capable of attacking enemy bases, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the hegemonic scenario of the Japanese reactionaries that they should not care about any war in order to become a leader of Asia.
					
					 The countries around Japan are targets of the SDF which has been beefed up as war forces. This time they selected Okinawa as the place for deployment of the short-range ballistic missile. This fact made it clearer that Japan is planning to ignite a war to stage a comeback to Korea and other neighboring countries just as it did in the last century.
					
					 Japan has so far lived in peace as it has preserved the above-said Constitution for form's sake. But if Japan embarks upon the road of undisguised militarist overseas invasion after throwing away the present Constitution like a pair of old shoes, the situation will be quite different from now.
					
					 The turn of Japan into a military giant and launch of overseas invasion will certainly lead it to a final ruin.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better give up at once their reckless action to drive the whole country into the abyss of ruin.

articles.title: Candlelight Action Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Action Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- A large candlelight action denouncing the puppet Intelligence Service's interference in the "presidential election" took place at Seoul Square on July 6 under the sponsorship of the Emergency Situation Council to Denounce IS's Interference in "Presidential Election" for Political Operation which consists of 200 plus civic and social organizations of south Korea. 
					 Over 10 000 people including members of civic and social organizations, citizens and lawmakers from opposition parties took part in the action. 
					
					 The participants bitterly denounced the IS for illegally interfering in the election for the conservative group's retaking of office. 
					
					 They called for conducting thorough investigation into the state policy on the case and severely punishing those concerned.
					
					 The then chief executive Lee Myung Bak is responsible for the IS's interference in the election and he should be subject to state investigation, they urged.

articles.title: Action for Erecting Monument to Victims of Sexual Slavery Staged
articles.content:
Action for Erecting Monument to Victims of Sexual Slavery Staged
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- An action for erecting the monument to victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army is being staged in Changwon City, South Kyongsang Province, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The Changwon area preparatory committee for promoting the erection of the monument held a press conference at the Changwon City Office on July 4, calling on people to turn out in the campaign for this.
					
					 The bitter grudge of those victims has not yet been settled since the liberation of Korea, they said, declaring they would expose abuses of women's rights and work hard so that such miserable history might not repeat itself.
					
					 They stressed that they would erect the monument to honor the memory of victims and struggle against all sorts of violence, discrimination and exploitation of women and the weak.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans' Paper Carries Special Write-up
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans' Paper Carries Special Write-up
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Thongil, a newspaper of Koreans published in Uzbekistan, on July 4 dedicated a special write-up to the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The paper carried a photo of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, the supreme temple of Juche.
					
					 Events are taking place in every nook and corner of the DPRK for praying for his immortality on the anniversary, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 The people are visiting the palace where he lies in state to pay tribute to him.

articles.title: Events for Solidarity with Korean People Held Abroad
articles.content:
Events for Solidarity with Korean People Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries on June 18 and 25 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 They included a solidarity meeting with the Korean people in Democratic Congo and lectures in Nigeria and Mali.
					
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo who doubles as chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, and other speakers expressed conviction that the Korean people would certainly win a victory in their struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country and socialism as they are led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. disband the "UN Command" at once as called for by  the resolution adopted at the 30th Session of the UN General Assembly, respond to the proposal for dialogue between the DPRK and U.S. for concluding a peace treaty and withdraw its forces from south Korea as early as possible.
					
					 Ahmed Blaza Lawan, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics, said in a lecture titled "Why did the U.S. ignite a Korean war?":
					
					 It was an irrefutable historical fact that the U.S. sought to secure a military strategic vantage for realizing its world domination through the Korean War and get rid of its predicament and save its stooges from their miserable fate.
					
					 The U.S., which sustained a heavy defeat in the war ignited by it, watched for a chance to invade the DPRK, oblivious of the shame it suffered in the 1950s. But it will not be able to dare provoke the DPRK as it has tremendous military capabilities and such the strongest weapon as single-minded unity.
					
					 Amadou Sangare, assistant to the director for the Logistic Department of the Malian Ministry of Defence said that the Korean War broke out on June 25, 1950 but the war had been actually started since the U.S. occupied south Korea after World War II. He cited concrete facts to prove it.
					
					 He recalled that the U.S. was compelled to bend its knees before the heroic Korean people and sign the Armistice Agreement little short of an instrument of surrender just three years after its provocation of the war.

articles.title: Events for Remembering Kim Il Sung Held Abroad
articles.content:
Events for Remembering Kim Il Sung Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Romania, Serbia, Kyrgyzstan and Iran on July 3 and 4 to commemorate the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were personages of the Romanian Socialist Union, the New Yugoslavia Communist Party of Serbia, the League of the Yugoslav Communist Youth, the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan and the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran and masses.
					
					 The chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said that the DPRK has demonstrated the might as a socialist power having a strong sense of independence and developed national defence industry and economic potential. This was thanks to the devoted efforts made by the President, he added.
					
					 He highly praised the President as the greatest man and an outstanding leader recognized by the world as he was endowed with distinguished leadership ability and boundless love for the people.
					
					 The general secretary of the New Yugoslavia Communist Party of Serbia stressed that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung for the human cause of independence are shining more brilliantly with the passage of the times and he is always alive in the hearts of all.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan noted that Kim Il Sung was a distinguished great man who founded the guiding idea in the era of independence, clearly indicating the road for mankind to follow.
					
					 The president of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran praised Kim Il Sung as a peerlessly great man and distinguished leader who made gigantic contributions to the happiness of the people, the prosperity of the country, national reunification and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Guinea
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The Guinean Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung released a special issue of its bulletin on July 2 on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of his demise.
					 The bulletin under the title "Kim Il Sung, shining august name" said that his august name is shining as a symbol of national liberation, era of independence, noble virtues and ennobling sense of obligation and a banner of eternal victory.
					
					 It in an article titled "Eternal sun of Juche" said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung is highly lauded by all people as eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea, providing a great guiding idea of the human cause of independence, ushering in an era of independence and leading it to shining victory with his unique Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He also ushered in a new era of the development of the fair international relations based on independence.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, who dedicated all his life to the cause of global independence, will always live in the hearts of progressive mankind as sun of Juche.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by Kim Il Sung and carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il is now given steady continuity by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. -0-

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Brazilian Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Brazilian Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- Brazilian organizations posted special write-ups on their websites on July 1 and 3 on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its website an article titled "Kim Il Sung, holding aloft the banner of independence" illustrated with a photo of him waving back to the cheering crowd.
					
					 The article said that Kim Il Sung, the founder of socialist Korea, performed undying exploits for the era and history, holding high the banner of independence.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 He worked heart and soul to accomplish the cause of global independence all his life.
					
					 He gave lucid answers to the principled issues arising in carrying out the cause of  global independence, including the issue of upholding independence in the struggle for peace and struggling against the imperialist aggressor forces through firm unity of the world peace-loving forces and the issue of struggling in unity and achieving  unity while waging a struggle.
					
					 He sincerely helped other countries in carrying out the cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung, shining august name."
					
					 The article said that his august name means the sun.

articles.title: "Power of Independence": German Media
articles.content:
"Power of Independence": German Media
 Pyongyang, July 9 (KCNA) -- The ISES Publishing House of Germany posted on its website a special write-up with a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung on July 4 to mark the 19th anniversary of his demise. 
					 Posted on the website were articles such as "Power of independence", "Option of DPRK" and "Broken ceasefire: war or peace".
					
					 The articles said: 
					
					 During the whole period of leading the revolution Kim Il Sung preserved the strong stand of independence that there may be big and small countries in the international relations but there can never be higher and lower ones. 
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il by inheriting the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung provided a reliable guarantee for the independent politics of the DPRK. 
					
					 Now the dear respected Kim Jong Un is leading the Korean revolution in the van. 
					
					 The DPRK was determined to have deterrence to cope with the U.S. nuclear threats that have reached the grave phase. 
					
					 The people of the DPRK, who regard sovereignty and dignity more valuable than their lives, have powerful strength enough to mercilessly punish those provokers wherever they might be in the globe. 
					
					 It is the invariable stand and perfect mode of counteraction of the army and people of the DPRK that a knife has to be responded with a sword and a rifle with a gun. 
					
					 The DPRK is neither the Balkans and Iraq nor Libya. It will never allow its sovereignty to be violated even a bit. 
					
					 The DPRK wants just and righteous peace, not one in humiliation. 
					
					 It is realistic and wise to say that peace is guaranteed by arms.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sudan del Sur
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Sudan del Sur
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este martes un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Sudan del Sur, Salva Kiir Mayardit, con motivo del 2o aniversario de la independencia de este pais. 
					El remitente expresa conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad entre la RPDC y Sudan del Sur se desarrollaran favorablemente conforme a los intereses y aspiracion comunes de los pueblos de los dos paises y desea el desarrollo y la prosperidad de Sudan del Sur.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun se reune con encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun se reune con encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- El canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun departio el dia 9 con el encargado de negocios a. i. de la Republica Arabe de Siria en Corea, Haissam Saad, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il se reune con encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il se reune con encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- El secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Yong Il, departio el dia 9 con el encargado de negocios a. i. de la Republica Arabe de Siria en Corea, Haissam Saad, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Regresan de Rusia Kim Kye Gwan y su comitiva
articles.content:
Regresan de Rusia Kim Kye Gwan y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- El primer vicecanciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Kye Gwan, y su comitiva regresaron el dia 9 a esta capital tras cumplir una visita a Rusia.
					Antes de su regreso, ellos se reunieron con Alexey Pushkov, presidente del Comite de Asuntos Internacionales de la Duma Estatal de Rusia.

articles.title: Asesor especial de secretario general de la ONU parte de esta capital
articles.content:
Asesor especial de secretario general de la ONU parte de esta capital
Pyongyang, 9 de julio (ACNC) -- Wilfried Lemke, asesor especial del secretario general de la ONU encargado del deporte para el desarrollo y la paz y su comitiva partieron este martes de esta capital.
